[Text] Mount Fuji, also called Fujiyama or Fuji-san in Japanese is the highest mountain in Japan. With a height of 12,388 feet, it is situated some 60 miles west of Tokyo. It is an active volcano but dormant since its last eruptions in 1707. Formation of lenticular clouds over Mount Fuji is a familiar natural incident.

[Title] Fact Check: This morphed image of Mount Fuji clouds the truth
[Text] Claim Lenticular clouds over Mount Fuji in Japan. Fact This is a photoshopped picture. The actual image was taken by one Raymond R Carr in 2005. [Title] What makes fake news feel true when it isn't? For one thing, hearing it ...
[Text] The influence of repetition is most pronounced for claims that people feel uncertain about, but is also observed when more diagnostic information about the claims is available (Fazio, Rand, & Pennycook, 2019; Unkelbach & Greifeneder, 2018).Worse, repetition even increases agreement among people who actually know that the claim is false — if only they thought about it (Fazio, Brashier, Payne ...
[Source] https://www.niemanlab.org/2020/08/what-makes-fake-news-feel-true-when-it-isnt-for-one-thing-hearing-it-over-and-over-again/)

[Title] Fact Check: This morphed image of Mount Fuji clouds the truth
[Text] Lenticular clouds over Mount Fuji in Japan. Fact This is a photoshopped picture. The actual image was taken by one Raymond R Carr in 2005. [Text] (Russell Stippey/Twitter) A different angle of the same lenticular cloud over San Diego County. (@dalber9131/Twitter) Lenticular clouds form most often in winter, but it is not uncommon to see them at other times of the year. These images were taken in August. The science behind lenticular clouds

[Title] Picture Alaska: Nature's UFOs and how they form - Alaska's News Source
[Text] The key ingredient is moisture-rich air and an object directly in the path of the wind. Because lenticular clouds can reach altitudes of up to 40,000 feet, the majority of these strange-looking clouds form near mountains. As the moist air slams into the mountain, it is forced upwards, where science comes into play.

[Title] Where to Start When Talking About Immigration | ParentMap
[Text] Kids need to feel safe and know that parents are there for them. Don't sugarcoat the truth, but do let kids know that they can help the people who are already working to make things better. Also, don't ignore race. In 2015, 26.9 percent of immigrants to the U.S. came from South Asia or East Asia, and 26.8 percent from Mexico.
[Source] https://www.parentmap.com/article/discuss-immigration-kids-age-recommendations)
[Title] How to Talk to Your Child about Immigration ... - InfoAboutKids
[Text] How to talk to your children about immigration: Start a conversation with your child. Ask your child what they have been hearing about immigration at school and from their friends. Give them an opportunity to ask questions. Explain what is going on in a way that they can understand.
[Source] https://infoaboutkids.org/blog/how-to-talk-to-your-child-about-immigration-recommendations-for-parents/)
